constraints.value: must never return to police work in any capacity, anywhere in the country
constraints.source_chunk: Alice Rodriguez served as a decorated police detective in the Chicago Police Department for nearly a decade. During those years, she worked alongside her partner, Detective Bob Chen, solving over thirty major cases together. They built a reputation as the department's most effective investigative team, earning commendations from Police Chief Carol Martinez, who had personally mentored Alice since her rookie days. But everything changed three years ago. Internal Affairs discovered that Alice had been accepting bribes from a local crime syndicate in exchange for tipping them off about upcoming raids. The investigation revealed years of corruption, and Alice narrowly avoided criminal prosecution by agreeing to resign immediately. Chief Martinez, feeling betrayed by her former protégé, made Alice sign an agreement: she must never return to police work in any capacity, anywhere in the country. The document was clear and legally binding.

The document was clear and legally binding. The scandal also destroyed the relationship between Bob and Carol. Bob had suspected Alice's corruption for months but Carol refused to investigate, protecting Alice until the evidence became undeniable. The betrayal shattered Bob's trust in Carol's leadership. After a heated confrontation in Carol's office, Bob transferred to a different precinct with one condition explicitly stated in his personnel file: he cannot and will not work with Chief Martinez ever again under any circumstances. Present Day - New York City

Alice Rodriguez has rebuilt her life as a private investigator in Manhattan, specializing in corporate fraud cases. She maintains a small office in Brooklyn and has earned a modest reputation for her thorough, ethical investigative work. Her past remains buried, known only to a few. Last Tuesday, Alice received an unexpected call from Bob Chen. "We need to talk," he said, his voice tense.

constraints.value: accepting bribes from a local crime syndicate
constraints.source_chunk: Alice Rodriguez served as a decorated police detective in the Chicago Police Department for nearly a decade. During those years, she worked alongside her partner, Detective Bob Chen, solving over thirty major cases together. They built a reputation as the department's most effective investigative team, earning commendations from Police Chief Carol Martinez, who had personally mentored Alice since her rookie days. But everything changed three years ago. Internal Affairs discovered that Alice had been accepting bribes from a local crime syndicate in exchange for tipping them off about upcoming raids. The investigation revealed years of corruption, and Alice narrowly avoided criminal prosecution by agreeing to resign immediately. Chief Martinez, feeling betrayed by her former protégé, made Alice sign an agreement: she must never return to police work in any capacity, anywhere in the country. The document was clear and legally binding.

incoming.description: Carol makes Alice sign an agreement preventing her from returning to police work.

constraints.value: refuse to reveal her confidential sources
constraints.source_chunk:
Carol even mentioned that she'd pulled strings to get Bob reassigned to the special task force. As the case intensified, Alice realized she needed official authority to pursue certain leads. After consulting with Carol and the Deputy Commissioner, Alice accepted a temporary badge and rejoined the police force as a special investigator. "It's just for this case," Carol assured her. "We need you working with full police powers."

Alice proved herself invaluable. Her honest and ethical approach to the investigation uncovered connections others had missed. She refused to reveal her confidential sources, protecting them even when pressured by senior officers. Bob, watching her work, felt his trust in Alice completely restored. "You're the same brilliant detective I remember," he told her. "Maybe even better."

The conspiracy was real, and Alice was determined to expose it, no matter where the evidence led.

The document was clear and legally binding. The scandal also destroyed the relationship between Bob and Carol. Bob had suspected Alice's corruption for months but Carol refused to investigate, protecting Alice until the evidence became undeniable. The betrayal shattered Bob's trust in Carol's leadership. After a heated confrontation in Carol's office, Bob transferred to a different precinct with one condition explicitly stated in his personnel file: he cannot and will not work with Chief Martinez ever again under any circumstances. Present Day - New York City

Alice Rodriguez has rebuilt her life as a private investigator in Manhattan, specializing in corporate fraud cases. She maintains a small office in Brooklyn and has earned a modest reputation for her thorough, ethical investigative work. Her past remains buried, known only to a few. Last Tuesday, Alice received an unexpected call from Bob Chen. "We need to talk," he said, his voice tense.

Her past remains buried, known only to a few. Last Tuesday, Alice received an unexpected call from Bob Chen. "We need to talk," he said, his voice tense. They met at a coffee shop in Queens where Bob explained he'd uncovered evidence of a massive conspiracy involving city officials and organized crime. "It's bigger than anything we ever handled in Chicago," Bob told her. "I need your help."

What Alice didn't know was that Chief Carol Martinez had personally selected her for this case. Carol, now working as a special advisor to the NYPD, had reviewed the evidence and believed only Alice had the skills to crack it. She assigned Alice as a special consultant to the police task force, offering full access to department resources and databases. Alice felt conflicted when she met Carol at the precinct headquarters.

Alice felt conflicted when she met Carol at the precinct headquarters. She trusted Bob's instincts completely—he had always been honest with her, even during her darkest days. But Carol's motives seemed unclear, almost suspiciously generous given their history. The investigation moved quickly. Alice reviewed thousands of pages of evidence, cross-referencing financial records with surveillance reports. Bob took the lead on fieldwork, conducting interviews with potential witnesses. Carol used her political connections to open doors that would normally remain closed, sharing insider information about which officials might be compromised. To Alice's surprise, Bob and Carol were working together seamlessly on the investigation, meeting daily to coordinate strategy. Their old tensions seemed forgotten, replaced by professional respect. Carol even mentioned that she'd pulled strings to get Bob reassigned to the special task force. As the case intensified, Alice realized she needed official authority to pursue certain leads.

Carol even mentioned that she'd pulled strings to get Bob reassigned to the special task force. As the case intensified, Alice realized she needed official authority to pursue certain leads. After consulting with Carol and the Deputy Commissioner, Alice accepted a temporary badge and rejoined the police force as a special investigator. "It's just for this case," Carol assured her. "We need you working with full police powers."

Alice proved herself invaluable. Her honest and ethical approach to the investigation uncovered connections others had missed. She refused to reveal her confidential sources, protecting them even when pressured by senior officers. Bob, watching her work, felt his trust in Alice completely restored. "You're the same brilliant detective I remember," he told her. "Maybe even better."

The conspiracy was real, and Alice was determined to expose it, no matter where the evidence led.

After a heated confrontation in Carol's office, Bob transferred to a different precinct with one condition explicitly stated in his personnel file: he cannot and will not work with Chief Martinez ever again under any circumstances. Present Day - New York City
